Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface IAsset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IIdentifier, Parcelable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFile, ISegmentedAsset
    public interface IAsset
extends IIdentifier
    Base interface for all the assets you can download.

    An asset may be a single file, or consist of multiple files.

    This interface provides access to all the attributes common to the specialized interfaces.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

        Parcelable.ClassLoaderCreator<T extends Object>, Parcelable.Creator<T extends Object>

    • Method Detail

      • getAssetURL

        String getAssetURL()
        Remote URL where the asset is being (will be) downloaded from.
        Returns:
        The location of the asset on the Internet.

      • getAssetId

        String getAssetId()
        ID that you supplied for this asset. This will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        Returns:
        The asset id.

      • getMetadata

        String getMetadata()
        Metadata that you set for this asset. Typically a JSON string.
        Returns:
        Metadata that you previously set for this asset.

      • setAssetUrl

        void setAssetUrl​(String aAssetUrl)
        Set the URL where the asset is to be downloaded from.
        Parameters:
        aAssetUrl - Remote URL where the asset lives on the Internet.

      • setMetadata

        void setMetadata​(String aMetaData)
        A convenience method allowing you to persist metadata with an asset.
        Parameters:
        aMetaData - The metadata to be persisted along with the asset. Typically a JSON String.

      • getExpectedSize

        double getExpectedSize()
        Expected size of this asset
        Returns:
        Expected size of the asset, in bytes.

      • getContentLength

        double getContentLength()
        Content length value provided by the server when download begins. If not yet retrieved, returns -1.
        Returns:
        Content length value as advertised by the remote HTTP server, or -1 if not yet fetched

      • getCurrentSize

        double getCurrentSize()
        Current size of this asset on disk (the amount downloaded).
        Returns:
        Current size of the asset, in bytes.

      • getFractionComplete

        double getFractionComplete()
        Current download progress, expressed as a fraction [0...1] where 0 is not started and 1 is complete.
        Returns:
        fraction complete of download

      • getErrorCount

        long getErrorCount()
        Number of errors encountered during download of this asset. This count is reset if the retry count is reset.
        Returns:
        The error count

      • getDownloadRetryLimit

        int getDownloadRetryLimit()
        Returns the fixed limit for the number of times the SDK will retry a failed download. The SDK will not reattempt a download once this limit is reached, unless the retry count is reset.
        Returns:
        The retry limit.

      • getDownloadRetryCount

        int getDownloadRetryCount()
        Number of times the SDK encountered an error during download of this asset and scheduled a retry. The retry may not yet have been completed. Once this value reaches the retry limit specified at getDownloadRetryLimit(), the SDK will stop attempting to download the asset.

        The retries may be reset if the maximum retries have been exceeded using IQueue.clearRetryCount(int).

        Returns:
        The error count

      • maximumRetriesExceeded

        boolean maximumRetriesExceeded()
        Indicates if this asset has exceeded the maximum number of SDK download retries. In this state the SDK will not retry the download unless the retry count for the asset is reset on the queue using IQueue.clearRetryCount(int).
        Returns:
        true if the maximum retries have been exceeded, false otherwise

      • isPlayable

        boolean isPlayable()
        Checks if the asset may be played at the current time. If not then calling getPlaybackURL() will return a null URL.
        Reasons for the asset not being available to play include:
        • Clock outside publish and expiry date windows
        • SDK offline time exceeded
        • Parsing not completed
        • Client side ads are being processed
        Returns:
        true if the asset can be played, false otherwise.

      • getPlaybackURL

        URL getPlaybackURL()
            throws MalformedURLException
        URL suitable for sending to the player. The returned playback URL will point at the VirtuosoClientHTTPService. The service must be running for the player to use it.

        To ensure the service is running, be sure to include the service and metadata declarations in the Android Manifest: 

         
 <meta-data android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.clienthttpservice.enabled" android:value="true" />

 <service android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:label="VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:exported="false"
            android:process=":vservice" >
    <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_VIRTUOSO_CLIENT_HTTP_SERVICE" />
    </intent-filter>
 </service>
        For a segmented asset this will be the URL for a manifest. For a flat file it will be the link to the file itself via the HTTP proxy.
        Returns:
        URL of the manifest / file, or null if outside of the availability window
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - If the generated url path is invalid when parsed by URL

      • getAdsURL

        URL getAdsURL()
       throws MalformedURLException
        URL that can be used to request ad package information from the HTTP proxy
        Returns:
        URL that will provide ad package information for the asset or null if the asset does not have ads
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - If the generated url path is invalid when parsed by URL

      • setStartWindow

        void setStartWindow​(long start)
        Set the start window for playback.

        Attempts to access or play this asset through a Virtuoso API will return null until this time has passed.

        A newly-created asset defaults to having a start window of 'now'.

        Parameters:
        start - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.

      • setEndWindow

        void setEndWindow​(long end)
        Set the end window for playback.

        After this time, the asset will no longer be available for playback through Virtuoso. Any attempt to retrieve the location of this asset on disk, through a Virtuoso API, will return null.

        After this time, Virtuoso will delete this asset from disk as soon as possible.

        Parameters:
        end - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.

      • getStartWindow

        long getStartWindow()
        Current start window applied to this asset
        Returns:
        A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch. 0 if a start window has not been set.

      • getEndWindow

        long getEndWindow()
        Current end window applied to this asset
        Returns:
        A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch. Returns Long.MAX_VALUE if an end window has not been set.

      • isWithinWindow

        boolean isWithinWindow()
        Report if the asset is within the start and end playback window and will be able to play. If this method returns false then getPlaybackURL() will return null.
        Returns:
        true if the asset is within the playback window and will play, false otherwise.

      • isExpired

        boolean isExpired()
        Return true if the asset is expired.
        Returns:
        true if expired, false otherwise.

      • getEap

        long getEap()
        (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Amount of time this asset will remain available to the user after it has been first played. As soon as possible after EAP has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete this asset. Note: For EAP windowing to work, Virtuoso must know when the asset is first played. It's your responsibility to register a play-start Event with Virtuoso.
        Returns:
        Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after first playout.
        See Also:
        Common.Events.addPlayStartEvent(android.content.Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • setEap

        void setEap​(long eap)
        (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has been first played.
        Parameters:
        eap - Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to remain available after first playout.

      • getEad

        long getEad()
        (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Duration this asset will remain available to the user after it has completed downloading. As soon as possible after EAD has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete the asset.
        Returns:
        Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after download completes.

      • setEad

        void setEad​(long ead)
        (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Set the duration this asset will remain available after it has completed downloading.
        Parameters:
        ead - Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to remain available after download completes.

      • setCustomHeaders

        void setCustomHeaders​(Bundle headers)
        Set custom HTTP headers for this asset.

        Virtuoso includes these headers as part of the HTTP GET request when downloading this asset. Virtuoso includes these headers after the default headers, and thus these take precedence.

        Parameters:
        headers - A bundle specifying the headers to be applied for this asset (key/value pairs).

      • getCustomHeaders

        Bundle getCustomHeaders()
        Custom HTTP headers you previously set for this asset
        Returns:
        The custom HTTP headers, or null if none have been set.

      • getCompletionTime

        long getCompletionTime()
        When this asset was marked as completed download, represented as seconds after the unix epoch
        Returns:
        When the asset completed downloading, in seconds since epoch.

      • getFirstPlayTime

        long getFirstPlayTime()
        When this asset was first played. Note: It is your responsibility to register a play-start event with Virtuoso; otherwise the returned value will be 0.
        Returns:
        When the asset was first played
        See Also:
        Common.Events.addPlayStartEvent(android.content.Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • getDownloadStatus

        int getDownloadStatus()
        Current download state: downloading, pending, blocked, etc.
        Returns:
        Current status of the asset
        See Also:
        Common.AssetStatus

      • getProcessingStatus

        int getProcessingStatus()
        Current processing state: ok, deleting, expiring. This method indicates if the SDK is currently performing a local action on the asset which will cause it to shortly be removed. Assets which display a state of deleting or expiring will not appear in a list from IAssetProvider.
        Returns:
        The current processing state.

      • getLastStatusCode

        int getLastStatusCode()
        Last known HTTP status code from the download of this asset
        Returns:
        The last response code or 0.

      • getLastPermissionResponse

        IAssetPermission getLastPermissionResponse()
        Permission response from Backplane.

        The permissions are requested from the backplane if the Max Account Downloads, Max Asset Downloads, or Max Asset Copies settings have been configured. They are also requested if Always Check Permissions setting is configured.

        The permission is evaluated when added to the queue. If configured and the permission check is not required at time of queuing then the permission code in the the IAssetPermission permission code will be set to PERMISSION_AWAITING_PERMISSI0N until the permission is checked at time of download.

        Returns:
        The IAssetPermission or null if not yet added to queue.

      • setAssetDownloadLimit

        void setAssetDownloadLimit​(int assetDownloadLimit)
        Asset download limit. The maximum number of times this asset may be downloaded onto a device. Set the limit for this asset.
        Parameters:
        assetDownloadLimit - The maximum number of downloads permitted.

      • getAssetDownloadLimit

        int getAssetDownloadLimit()
        Asset download limit. The maximum number of times this asset may be downloaded onto a device. Get the current limit for this asset.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of downloads permitted.

      • setClientSideAdSupport

        void setClientSideAdSupport​(boolean adSupport)
        Set if this asset supports advertising through client side ad insertion.
        Parameters:
        adSupport - true if ad templates should be downloaded and used with this asset during offline playback.

      • adSupport

        int adSupport()
        Check if the asset supports advertising, and if so which type
        Returns:
        the type of ad support, which indicates if ads should be managed, either using client insertion or server insertion during offline playback.
        See Also:
        Common.AdSupportType

      • usesFastPlay

        boolean usesFastPlay()
        Check if the asset supports the fastplay feature.
        Returns:
        true if fastplay is supported

      • fastPlayReady

        boolean fastPlayReady()
        Check if the asset is available for fastplay.
        Returns:
        true if the asset is ready to play with cached segments.
